name: Benedict Chukwuka Enwonwu
awards: Member of the Order of the British Empire
summary: Odinigwe Benedict Chukwukadibia Enwonwu MBE (14 July 1917 â€“ 5 February 1994), better known as Ben Enwonwu, was a Nigerian painter and sculptor. He is one of the pioneers whose career opened the way for the postcolonial proliferation and increased visibility of modern African art, and was the first Nigerian contemporary artist to win international acclaim. His work has been exhibited around the world. The Enwonwu crater on the planet Mercury is named in his honour.
